what: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: Constructs data frame mapping package names earliest known appearance CRAN archive, inferred file modification times.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: cran_archive_db Optional result tools::CRAN_archive_db(). supplied, retrieved internally.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: data frame columns: package – package name archive_date – earliest archive date (Date) NA

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: CRAN archive database named list data frames, one per package. package, earliest file mtime used proxy archive entry date. Packages empty archive entries return NA. function intended called result reused efficient per-package lookups.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df

what: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: Parses character string (typically derived CRAN URL /BugReports fields) extracts first GitHub user/repository pair finds.

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: url_text single character string containing one URLs free-form text may include GitHub repository link.

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: one-row data frame two character columns: github_user GitHub account name, NA_character_ found github_repo GitHub repository name, NA_character_ found

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: function looks URLs form: github.com/<user>/<repo> (optionally ending .git). GitHub repository can identified, one-row data frame NA values returned. function always returns data frame, making safe use purrr::map() followed purrr::list_rbind().

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
code: extract_github_repo("https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2") #>   github_user github_repo #> 1   tidyverse     ggplot2  extract_github_repo("Bug reports at https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs/issues") #>   github_user github_repo #> 1       r-lib       vctrs  extract_github_repo(NA_character_) #>   github_user github_repo #> 1        <NA>        <NA>

title: Find the first commit in a GitHub repository — first_repo_commit
Find the first commit in a GitHub repository — first_repo_commit
text: owner GitHub repository owner. repo GitHub repository name. sha Optional commit SHA branch name start . Defaults repository’s default branch.

title: Find the first commit in a GitHub repository — first_repo_commit
text: one-row data frame commit SHA, date, author, message, URL.

title: Find the first commit in a GitHub repository — first_repo_commit
text: function follows pagination links retrieve oldest commit reachable specified ref.

title: Find the first commit in a GitHub repository — first_repo_commit

what: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
title: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
text: Searches GitHub repository earliest commit given symbol (typically function name) assigned R source file. search performed via GitHub API require local clone.

title: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
code: get_first_commit(   owner,   repo,   function_name,   date_only = TRUE,   path = NULL,   pattern = NULL,   branch = NULL,   max_commits = Inf )

title: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
text: owner GitHub account name. repo GitHub repository name. function_name Name symbol search . date_only Logical; TRUE (default), return commit date. FALSE, return one-row data frame commit metadata. path Optional path R source file search. NULL, suitable file inferred automatically. pattern Optional regular expression used detect symbol assignment. Defaults matching <name> <- <name> =. branch Optional branch ref search. Defaults repository’s default branch. max_commits Maximum number commits inspect giving .

title: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
text: date_only = TRUE, character string giving commit date (ISO 8601), NULL match found. date_only = FALSE, one-row data frame commit metadata, NULL match found.

title: Find the first GitHub commit introducing a symbol — get_first_commit
text: path supplied, GitHub code search used identify candidate .R files, function selects first file whose current contents actually assign symbol scanning commit history.

what: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
text: Identifies earliest Git commit given symbol becomes explicitly exported package’s NAMESPACE file (e.g. via export(foo) export("foo")).

title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
code: get_first_export(   owner,   repo,   function_name,   date_only = TRUE,   branch = NULL,   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")),   file = "NAMESPACE" )

title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
text: owner GitHub account name (e.g. "YuLab-SMU"). repo GitHub repository name (e.g. "ggtree"). function_name Name symbol search (e.g. "geom_aline"). date_only Logical; TRUE (default), return commit date. FALSE, return one-row data frame commit metadata. branch Optional branch ref search. Defaults repository’s default branch. cache_dir Directory used cache cloned repositories. supplied explicitly, function uses value ggext.git_cache option, falling back temporary directory. file Path NAMESPACE file within repository. Defaults "NAMESPACE".

title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
text: date_only = TRUE, Date giving commit date symbol first exported, NULL explicit export found. date_only = FALSE, one-row data.frame columns: date Commit date author Commit author name message Commit message url URL commit GitHub file File searched (usually NAMESPACE)

title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export
text: function works cloning package repository locally (, cache directory) searching Git history NAMESPACE file. initial clone, operations local use GitHub API, avoiding rate-limit issues. function detects explicit exports . currently interpret exportPattern() semantics; packages rely solely pattern-based exports may return NULL. initial call given repository may slow due cloning. Subsequent calls fast long cached clone reused. best performance across sessions, set persistent cache location:

title: Find the first commit where a function is exported — get_first_export

what: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: Determines whether package currently CRAN, CRAN archive, neither location, returns earliest known release date.

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: pkg Character scalar. Package name. cran_package_db data frame returned tools::CRAN_package_db(). archive_df data frame columns package archive_date, typically created build_archive_df().

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: one-row data frame columns: package – package name first_release – earliest known release date (Date) NA

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: function performs constant-time lookups using precomputed inputs intended called repeatedly many packages.

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cran_db <- tools::CRAN_package_db() archive_df <- build_archive_df()  get_first_release("ggplot2", cran_db, archive_df) } # }

what: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: Transforms GitHub Pages URLs form https://<user>.github.io/<repo>/ corresponding GitHub repository URLs: https://github.com/<user>/<repo>.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: url character vector URLs. element may GitHub Pages URL URL.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: character vector URLs length url. GitHub Pages URLs converted GitHub repository URLs; URLs returned -.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: Non–GitHub Pages URLs returned unchanged. function detects GitHub Pages URLs using pattern https://<user>.github.io/<repo>/. user-level Pages URLs include repository path converted. Root Pages URLs https://<user>.github.io/ left unchanged, map unambiguously single repository.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
